list_definition.definition: a small exploding device giving off a colourful display of lights

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: If your sister finds out, there’ll be fireworks (= a display of anger)!

list_ex_of_english: Is someone who has fireworks in his possession going to be arrested by the police and charged with possessing fireworks?
Of course, it is already illegal to sell fireworks to children.
None of us who are in our mature years can remember from our youth anything like the type of fireworks that we see nowadays.
The period of sale of fireworks is an issue for the voluntary code of practice.
The ceremony thus became a component of a solemn feast in the church, including orchestral music, fireworks and alms to the poor, all paid for by the girl's family.
I have no plans to introduce further controls on fireworks.
I shall come on to the dates later, as there is a big issue about the periods when fireworks can be used.
Indeed, we take measures to ensure that unsafe fireworks do not find their way on to the market.
